data.text: @HSELive Hi there, if I visit Dublin next month, as an international tourist, would I be able to get the Novavax vaccine at a walk in clinic?
@HSELive Is St Fintan's Campus in St Fintan's Hospital?

@HSELive https://t.co/jjNgemSe7I     The vaccines are dangerous for children and the benefit-risk ratio for the vaccine does work in for children. It is far riskier to give this to your children,in fact myocarditis/pericarditis is real effect.The vaccine is not for the present variant too

📍Moate Youth and Community Sports Centre, Westmeath
Booster for people aged 12 and older: 12pm to 7pm
Dose 1 and 2: 12pm to 7pm

📍Roscommon Vaccination Centre, Golf Links Road
Booster for people aged 12 and older: 11am to 4pm
Dose 1 and 2: 11am to 4pm
Dose 1 for children aged 5 to 11: 4pm to 7.30pm

@HSELive Covid variants keep coming up, masks will be around for a while. app Bost makes it safe and easy to communicate with people nearby. Download for free at Apple https://t.co/uChWynVbJG & Google https://t.co/Nvi0yitq3f https://t.co/6e1jUnjtCj

📍Scoil Carmel, Limerick City
Booster for people aged 12 and older: 8.30am to 4.30pm
Dose 1 and 2: 8.30am to 4.30pm

📍Glencarn Hotel, Monaghan
Booster for people aged 12 and older: 2.30pm to 7.30pm
Dose 1 and 2: 2.30pm to 7.30pm

📍Primary Care Centre, Carrick on Shannon
Booster for people aged 12 and older: 9.30am to 12.30pm
Dose 1 and 2 for people aged 12 and older: 9.30am to 12.30pm
Dose 1 for children aged 5 to 11: 1.30pm to 6.30pm
